p: Microorganisms produce various enzymes, including β-glucosidase, β-glycosidase, β-galactosidase, and l-arabinofuranosidase, which may transform ginsenosides by cleaving the sugar moieties at C–3, C–6, and/or C–20. The transformation pathways for microbial fermentation [ 7, 62, 110] were as follows: Rb1→Rd→F2→CK; Rb1→Rd→Rg3→Rh2; Rb1, Rb2, Rc→Rd; Rc→Mc→CK; Rb2→compound O→compound Y→CK; Re→Rg2, Rh1; Re→Rg1→Rh1; and Rf→Rh1.
